original_title: Mini 3D-Printed Press Is Sure To Make An Impression
original_content:
Making stamps out of potatoes that have been cut in half is always a fun activity with the kids. But if youve got a 3D printer, you could really step up your printing game by building a mini relief printing press.
To create the gear bed/rack, [Kevr102] used a Fusion 360 add-in called GF Gear Generator. At first this was the most finicky part of the process, but then it was time to design the roller gears. However, [Kevr102] got through it with some clever thinking and a little bit of good, old-fashioned eyeballing.
Per [Kevr102], this press is aimed at the younger generation of printers in that the roller mechanism is spring-loaded to avoid pinched fingers. [Kevr102] 3D-printed some of the printing tablets, which is a cool idea. Unfortunately it doesnt work that well for some styles of text, but most things came out looking great. You could always use a regular linocut linoleum tile, too.
This isnt the first 3D-printed printing press to grace these pages. Heres one that works like a giant rubber stamp.
title: 3Dプリンターで作るミニレリーフ印刷プレス
body: 子供たちとポテトスタンプを作るのは楽しいが、3Dプリンターを使えばリリーフ印刷機を作れる。必要部品はFusion 360のGF Gear Generatorで設計。ばね付きのローラーメカニズムを採用し、テキストには適していないが他の印刷物は素晴らしい仕上がり。
titles: 3Dプリンターで作るミニレリーフ印刷プレス
子どもと楽しむジャガイモで作るスタンプの代わりに3Dプリンターを活用
GF Gear Generatorを使ったギアベッド/ラックの作成方法
ローラギアの設計と3Dプリントによる印刷タブレットの製作
年少プリンター向けのバネ式ローラ機構を採用した3D印刷印刷プレス
